post.description:
This is a stateless endpoint that takes a recipe object and returns an enriched version.
It does NOT modify any database records. The client can apply the enriched data
via a normal PUT /api/recipes/{id} call.

Currently enriches tags by suggesting from the user's existing tag library.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date (inclusive), format: YYYY-MM-DD. Defaults to today.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date (inclusive), format: YYYY-MM-DD. Defaults to start_date + 6 days (one week).

200.description: List of meal plans for date range

400.description: Invalid request (recipe not found or deleted)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return (default: 20, max: 1000)

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Search query with optional filters. Supports:
- Plain text: searches title and description
- tag:value: filter by tag (can use multiple)
- source:value: filter by source name
- has:photos / no:photos: filter by photo presence
- created:>2024-01-01: created after date
- created:<2024-12-31: created before date
- created:2024-01-01..2024-12-31: created in date range

Example: "chicken tag:dinner tag:quick has:photos"

parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: Sort direction (default: desc). Ignored when sort_by=random.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: Optional version ID to fetch a specific version instead of current

201.description: Scrape job created from captured HTML

200.description: List of user's tags with IDs and recipe counts

409.description: Tag with that name already exists

html.description: The HTML content of the page to extract a recipe from

source_url.description: The URL the HTML came from (used for source attribution)

url.description: URL to scrape for recipe data

ErrorResponse.description: Shared error response used by all endpoints

ImportExtractionMethod.description: Extraction method for imported recipes (mirrors ramekin_core::ExtractionMethod)

ImportRawRecipe.description: Raw recipe data for import (mirrors ramekin_core::RawRecipe)

image_urls.description: Image URLs found in the recipe (not used for imports with pre-uploaded photos)

instructions.description: Instructions as a blob (could be HTML or plain text)

source_url.description: Source URL (optional for imports without a web source)

ImportRecipeRequest.description: Request body for importing a recipe

photo_ids.description: Photo IDs that have already been uploaded via POST /api/photos

raw_recipe.description: The raw recipe data (converted from import source by client)

measurements.description: Measurements - first is primary, rest are alternatives (e.g., "1 stick" then "113g")

section.description: Section name for grouping (e.g., "For the sauce", "For the dough")

RecipeContent.description:
Core recipe content - all fields that can be enriched by AI.
Used for: Enrich API request/response, base for CreateRecipeRequest.

updated_at.description: When viewing a specific version, this is the version's created_at

thumbnail_photo_id.description: Photo ID of the first photo (thumbnail), if any

can_retry.description: Whether this job can be retried

status.description: Current job status (pending, scraping, parsing, completed, failed)

recipe_count.description: Number of recipes using this tag

notes.description: Set to empty string to clear notes, or provide new value

VersionSummary.description: Version summary for listing version history
